conclusion: Determine the magnitude and direction of the resultant Ampere force on the trapezoidal frame.
Calculate the total resistance of the trapezoidal frame using the formula R = (ρ * l) / S.
Resistance of each segment ab, bc, cd is R = (ρL) / S.
Length of segment ad is (5L) / 2 using geometry.
Resistance of segment ad is R = (5ρL) / (2S).
Current I through the frame is I = (2ES) / (11ρL).
Ampere force on a segment is F = I * l * B * sin(θ).
Ampere force on segment ab is F1 = (ES√3B) / (11ρ), direction: Downward-left.
Ampere force on segment bc is F2 = (ES√3B) / (11ρ), direction: Upward-right.
Ampere force on segment cd is F3 = (ES√3B) / (11ρ), direction: Downward-left.
Ampere force on segment ad is F4 = (5ESB) / (11ρ), direction: Rightward.
